ygData.subject: Re: Vial Prices
ygData.msgSnippet: so far, have sold 3 of each at about these prices, and found 1 person who decided to wait on a potter fried, and another who said good prices, but none needed
ygData.messageBody:
so far, have sold 3 of each at about these prices, and found 1 person who
decided to wait on a potter fried, and another who said good prices, but
none needed at the time....
not much of a market at the moment it seems....

doesn't help that noone has any idea where to get poison making supplies or
instructions.

currently thinking about selling at 2pp for normal, 5pp for lined, with 10%
off per 5, up to 40% off...tho i may give up on it when i max my pottery
again if the market doesn't improve...

skill is at 153, and lined is still not trivial

Xillitil/Povar

>
>From: Jacob@... (Cedrick)
>
>On Fri, 30 Jul 1999 23:15:51 GMT, Xillitil of Povar wrote:
>
> >was planning on 2pp for normal, and 4-5pp for lined, mebbe a bit lower
> >depending on demand and volume...hard part is gonna be finding enough
>high
> >level rogues who don't do pottery themselves or already have a
>supplier...
>
>Here's the problem with this. A friend of mine started from scratch since
>the patch and started pottery. He made master level in about 30 plat. If
>you charge 2p per vial, why would he not just become a potter himself? I
>mean, for the cost of 15 vials, he can make his own, never have to auction,
>never have a shortage.
>
>The problem is, I consider 2p a perfectly reasonable price considering the
>costs of making the vials. The problem is that EQ trade skills are messed
>up and this is just another example if it.
>
>Cedrick
>
